title: Tires and Tread Life: Probability
question_text:
A certain type of tire's tread life is approximately normal with a mean of $42,000\text{ miles}$ and standard deviation of $3000\text{ miles}$.
The shaded area in the figure below represents which of the following probabilities?

choices.text: The probability the tread life of this type of tire is between $36000\text{ miles}$ and $45000\text{ miles}$.
The probability the tread life of this type of tire is between $36000\text{ miles}$ and $48000\text{ miles}$.
The probability the tread life of this type of tire is between $39000\text{ miles}$ and $45000\text{ miles}$.
The probability the tread life of this type of tire is between $39000\text{ miles}$ and $48000\text{ miles}$.
The probability the tread life of this type of tire is between $39000\text{ miles}$ and $51000\text{ miles}$.
